name: bwa

variants.name: build_system
variants.description: Build systems supported by the package

description: Burrow-Wheeler Aligner for pairwise alignment between DNA sequences.

dependencies.name: zlib
dependencies.description:
A free, general-purpose, legally unencumbered lossless data-compression
library.

dependencies.name: sse2neon
dependencies.description:
A C/C++ header file that converts Intel SSE intrinsics to Arm/Aarch64
NEON intrinsics.

dependent_to.name: polypolish
dependent_to.description:
Polypolish is a tool for polishing genome assemblies with short reads.
Unlike other tools in this category, Polypolish uses SAM files where
each read has been aligned to all possible locations (not just a single
best location). This allows it to repair errors in repeat regions that
other alignment-based polishers cannot fix.

dependent_to.name: py-ipyrad
dependent_to.description:
An interactive toolkit for assembly and analysis of restriction-site
associated genomic data sets (e.g., RAD, ddRAD, GBS) for population
genetic and phylogenetic studies.

dependent_to.name: py-vcf-kit
dependent_to.description:
VCF-kit is a command-line based collection of utilities for performing
analysis on Variant Call Format (VCF) files.

dependent_to.name: py-haphpipe
dependent_to.description:
HAplotype and PHylodynamics pipeline for viral assembly, population
genetics, and phylodynamics.

dependent_to.name: biopieces
dependent_to.description:
The Biopieces are a collection of bioinformatics tools that can be
pieced together in a very easy and flexible manner to perform both
simple and complex tasks.

dependent_to.name: hybpiper
dependent_to.description:
HybPiper was designed for targeted sequence capture, in which DNA
sequencing libraries are enriched for gene regions of interest,
especially for phylogenetics. HybPiper is a suite of Python scripts that
wrap and connect bioinformatics tools in order to extract target
sequences from high-throughput DNA sequencing reads

dependent_to.name: reditools
dependent_to.description:
REDItools: python scripts for RNA editing detection by RNA-Seq data.
REDItools are simple python scripts conceived to facilitate the
investigation of RNA editing at large-scale and devoted to research
groups that would to explore such phenomenon in own data but don't have
sufficient bioinformatics skills. They work on main operating systems
(although unix/linux-based OS are preferred), can handle reads from
whatever platform in the standard BAM format and implement a variety of
filters.

dependent_to.name: fastq-screen
dependent_to.description:
FastQ Screen allows you to screen a library of sequences in FastQ format
against a set of sequence databases so you can see if the composition of
the library matches with what you expect.

dependent_to.name: py-quast
dependent_to.description: Quality Assessment Tool for Genome Assemblies

dependent_to.name: phyluce
dependent_to.description:
phyluce (phy-loo-chee) is a software package that was initially
developed for analyzing data collected from ultraconserved elements in
organismal genomes

dependent_to.name: redundans
dependent_to.description: Redundans pipeline assists an assembly of heterozygous genomes.

dependent_to.name: pgdspider
dependent_to.description:
"PGDSpider is a powerful automated data conversion tool for population
genetic and genomics programs

dependent_to.name: abyss
dependent_to.description:
ABySS is a de novo, parallel, paired-end sequence assembler that is
designed for short reads. The single-processor version is useful for
assembling genomes up to 100 Mbases in size.
